Political opposition with allegations of abuse against women

analysis.purpose: To provide political advice regarding media treatment of sexual assault allegations against Bill Clinton during the 2016 election
analysis.significance: Shows communication between Larry Summers and Jeffrey Epstein about political strategy during the 2016 presidential election, specifically regarding sexual misconduct allegations

notable_quotes: Press is so revolted by trump that I'd expect they will not be for benefit of doubt.

red_flags: Discussion of sensitive political allegations during election season

details: Discussion of press/media reaction to Trump and political allegations

public_knowledge.context: This references the 2016 presidential election where Donald Trump did bring forward women who accused Bill Clinton of sexual misconduct, which was widely covered in media

analysis.summary: Larry Summers emails Jeffrey Epstein about the 2016 presidential election, noting that the press is so opposed to Trump that they may not give Bill Clinton the 'benefit of the doubt' regarding sexual assault allegations brought forward by Trump, referencing a previous dinner conversation about this political dynamic.
